[b]Co się, psia krew, właśnie stało?![/b]

Właśnie taka była moja reakcja na napisy końcowe. No, może nie do końca, bo wypowiedziałem to jedynie w myślach. Usta były wtedy wykrzywione w grymasie przypominający emotikonę [b]:o[/b].

Grę ukończyłem raz, dwa razy obejrzałem też cały gameplay. Choć od tego czasu minęło już trochę czasu - i edytuję recenzję - wciąż mogę oprzeć się na tezie, że to [b]najlepsza rzecz, jaka spotkała mnie na platformie Steam [/b]. Uważam tę grę - a właściwie coś ponad zwykłe gry - za istne arcydzieło. 

Choć nieco zmieniłbym same zasady rozgrywki (m.in. za dużo strzelania), tak cała produkcja zapada w pamięci na długi czas. Czy ją polecam? Nawet najgorszemu wrogowi.

+ Fabuła, wciskająca w fotel, przewracająca ten fotel a potem kopiąca Cię po łbie,
+ Grafika, lekko komiksowa, baśniowa, lecz zarazem bardzo dojrzała,
+ Dźwięk, istna poezja dla uszu,
+ Optymalizacja, stabilne 30FPS nawet na sprzęcie sprzed kilku lat, 
+ Elizabeth i Booker, para najlepiej wykreowanych bohaterów ostatniej dekady!

Co do minusów, dostrzegam tylko dwa. Ponadto, dla niektórych mogą być dodatkowymi plusami, więc...

-/+ Gra jest dość trudna, nawet na normalnym trybie trudności. 
-/+ Jak dla mnie, za dużo strzelania, za mało zwiedzania. 


[b]Do kupienia nawet bez promocji.[/b]

Я - человек, который не разу не проходил не одну игру до конца, прошла Bioshock Infinite дважды.
Я - человек, который всегда начинал проходить игры только на легком уровне сложности - прошла данную игру еще и на среднем.
Ценю игры за сюжет, но здесь я оценила все: геймплей, дизайн уровней, ну и конечно же, сюжет.
В последнее время мало что можно выделить из книг, игр или фильмов, касаемо сюжета, но Bioshock Infinite, безусловно, стоит внимания и времени.
Если не проходить, то обязательно вникнуть в сюжет - советую!
Ce jeu est tous simplement ENORME !!!! l'un des meilleurs jeux auquels j'ai joué, l'histoire est EXELLENTE, on ne se lasse pas des personnages. Tous y est !

The Bioshock franchise in my opinion is one of the best experiences one can have. From the rich and mildly (but not too hard to grasp) complex lore to the beautiful streets and characters of Rapture and Columbia. Specifically, Bioshock Infinite and especially the two beautiful DLC's i.e., Burial at Sea 1 and 2 are missing pieces of the puzzle. The thread that connects and resolves all questions a follower of the franchise may have. The gameplay/shooting is beautiful especially if you consider that it is a game released at 2013. 

Overall, one of the best, mind-blowing experiences one may have. Strongly reccomended!

P.S. : For the players that have not played any Bioshock game and wish to start. Try playing Bioshock games in the following order: 
[1] Bioshock Infinite
[2] Bioshock 1
[3] Bioshock 2 
[4] Bioshock 2 - Minerva's Den
[5] Bioshock Infinite - Burial at Sea: episode 1
[6] Bioshock Infinite - Burial at Sea: episode 2

Thank you Ken Levine for this wonderful creation and story !

This was a really good story with okay gameplay. I like getting my mind blown metaphorically, and BioShock Infiite delivers. Almost every part of this game is amusing or interesting in som form or another.

For an 11 hours game I wouldn't pay too much for this game, but it's well worth it if you can get it on sale. At least it's worth the same amount as you would pay for a movie-ticket.

Никогда бы не подумал, что шутер от первого лица способен впечатлять сюжетом. Bioshock Infinite сполна развеял мой скепсис, предложив такой уровень драматургии и постановки, который и не в каждой хорошей книге увидишь. Знаете, вообще я сейчас могу долго и нудно разгагольствовать о всех несомненных достоинствах этой игры, однако, предчувствуя всю бессмысленность данного действа, не стану утомлять вас обилием восторженных эпитетов, набивших оскомину клише типа "живая классика", "шедевр цифровой индустрии" и прочей вульгарщиной, а просто процитирую одного небезызвестного не в меру упитанного игрового журналиста: "10 из 10, и даже 11, нет, 12 из 10". Тем самым, как вы поняли, я выражаю свою солидарность данной оценке и настоятельно рекомендую к ознакомлению всем еще не причастившимся к сему замечательному произведению искусства. Ах да, Букер, лови!

Bought this because it was on sale this past week. Unofortunately neglected to purchase the pack with all the DLC. I haven't played the original Bioshock or Bioshock 2 so I didn't really know what to expect when I started up Bioshock Infinite. Great storyline with a very interesting ending. Gameplay was fun, sort of reminded me of Assassin's Creed meets Fallout with less of an RPG feel. Felt very similar to the 2008 Tomb Raider that I also bought not too long ago. Anyway, great buy, definitely worth shelling out a few bucks for. Can't say anything about the DLC seeing as I'm still on the fence whether to buy it or not, but I would highly recommend this game, especially if you're into trippy endings.

I thought a lot on how to approach this review, but I got lazy so I'll make it short.

The game is a hit-or-miss. You either like this game very much, or you hate it.

If you are in it for the story, you may like it a lot, but if you are in it for the gameplay, you may be disappointed since it's not like BioShock or BioShock 2 (if you have played them). It's similar, of course, but not at the same level of "depth". I found it enjoyable (the first time).

The art direction in this game is 10/10, so is the sountrack.

I don't feel like reviewing this game, this is just a record of how I feel now that I finished the main story. Honestly don't read this unless you've played the game already, it's either gonna ruin the game for you if you decide to buy the game regardless or it you will miss out on a great game. See? This is all you needed, I "recommended" it, now get out.

I feel... mostly disappointed. In the game, in myself in the disgusting "Clash in the Clouds" DLC. Seriously don't play that. Infinite is not bad, it's really not. Maybe if I hadn't watched a Let's Play of it when it came out... maybe it would have been different. The story is ok, it's not all that thrilling once you realize that some things don't quite fit together but it doesn't have glaring plot holes so I don't think people that play it for the first time will really notice what I mean. For me, four things "broke" the game for me. 
The glitches, there are a bunch and for a game whose value is SO tied to Elizabeth it didn't help that many of the glitches were tied to her.
The pacing(and the dialogue). Infinite was too fast paced in my opinion, it goes from plot point to plot point without fully developing the characters in between.
Example{BIG Spoilers}:

[spoiler]Towards the end of the game Comstock tell Liz to ask Booker about her finger, he freaks out and kills him, he says that he will prove he had nothing to do with her finger by destroying "the Syphon"(no need to know what that is) to unlock Liz' powers. Thing is, how did he know that destroying the Syphon would in any way help prove his innocence? Who knows, but it gets worse, when they are finally about to destroy the Syphon after the most annoying battle in the game, the narrative is flipped and he asks Liz "if she's sure" to which she answers "it's the only way". HE wanted to destroy the Syphon. Eh, whatever, there is more of that in the game, my big issue is that it could have been fixed with 3 more lines of dialogue where they think about how to solve the problem instead of just doing something, anything, to advance the plot. It makes the game feel rushed, which it didn't really need to be.
[/spoiler]

The battles, this one ties in with the pacing. Battles are everywhere, you fight all the time and you fight everybody. Sure you can skip most of them but that just means running through the enemies and hoping you get to the next area without having to open a lock which is only possible after you clear the enemies. Irrational, why are you trying to push the whole "Booker is a genocidal maniac" angle so much?

But in the end, the one thing that made this into a mediocre game for me was that I couldn't make myself like Liz, there were times where I felt compassion for her but that was it, I had no urge to "save her" if it wasn't for a feeling of "well I guess it'd be kinda shitty of me to just leave". [spoiler] And I wasn't happy when she choked my like a baby in it's cradle [/spoiler] In the end this is why I recommend this game, most people will be able to look past mistakes this game makes because they will like her, I envy those people. I don't remember what I felt for Liz when I watched that Let's Play years ago, I wish I did, did I fell in love with the character or was it the same? In the end I didn't love her like Liara, I didn't identify with her like Jodie and I didn't want to protect her like Ellie. I feel bad about it, so I guess that's something. A unique feeling for a... unique character.
